byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID E. SANGER

abstract: Sen Bob Corker, Republican Senate Foreign Relations Committee chairman, implores Pres Obama to submit to Congressional vote before seeking United Nations endorsement of nuclear agreement with Iran; warning is latest development in tense standoff between White House and congressional Republicans over potential deal.
lead_paragraph: The warning from Senator Bob Corker, Republican of Tennessee, was the latest twist in an increasingly tense standoff between the White House and congressional Republicans over the potential nuclear accord.

headline.main: Senator Corker Pushes Obama for Congressional Vote on Iran Deal
headline.print_headline: Republican Senator Pushes Obama on Iran Talks

snippet: The warning from Senator Bob Corker, Republican of Tennessee, was the latest twist in an increasingly tense standoff between the White House and congressional Republicans over the potential nuclear accord.
